ISSUE.TITLE: An email sent to a vendor should not be in the customer language
ISSUE.DESCRIPTION: There are several emails sent to vendors. For example, when an order is placed or paid for. However in that case it uses the language of a customer. One more certain example, OrderProcessingService class invokes _workflowMessageService.SendOrderPlacedVendorNotification(order, vendor, order.CustomerLanguageId); We could do it the following way. Add a new extension method to "Vendor" entity (then we can use this method to load vendor language). First, it'll load an associated customer record. And then load its language by "Language ID" (like it's done in other classes). If language is not found, then load default language. If not found, then load the first found one. But... a vendor could have multiple customer records associated. Load the first found customer? We could add "LanguageId" property to "Vendor" record. But it'll just make solution much more complex Let's discuss and choose a better approach first Maybe, just use a default store language? Source: http://www.nopcommerce.com/boards/t/34454/bug-or-hidden-feature-nevertheless-an-email-sent-to-a-vendor-should-not-be-in-the-customers-language.aspx

COMMIT.MESSAGE: #1005 An email sent to a vendor should not be in the customer language
